startup.description: Application starts successfully using 'uv run main.py'
startup.notes: The game initializes pygame, creates the game window with caption 'Vector Space Invaders', and sets up the display mode at 800x600 resolution.

tested_features.description: Player tank can move left and right using arrow keys with proper boundary checking
Player can shoot bullets using SPACE key with single-shot restriction (can_shoot flag)
Aliens move horizontally and drop down when hitting screen boundaries (5x8 grid)
Player bullets collide with aliens, alien bullets collide with player
Points awarded based on alien row (10/20/30 points for bottom/middle/top rows)
Player starts with 3 lives, game ends when lives reach 0
New wave spawns when all aliens are cleared
Game over screen displayed with final score and restart option (R key)
Vector-style graphics with neon colors on dark background, animated starfield
Score, lives, and wave counter displayed at top of screen

verified_rules: Alien horizontal speed: 2 pixels per frame

exit_handling.description: Application exits cleanly on ESC key press or window close

code_quality_notes.architecture: Well-structured object-oriented design with separate classes for Player, Bullet, Alien, AlienSwarm, Star, and Game
code_quality_notes.type_hints: Type annotations present throughout the codebase
code_quality_notes.documentation: Docstrings provided for all classes and methods
code_quality_notes.constants: Game constants properly defined at module level

summary: The Vector Space Invaders game starts successfully and all basic functionality works as expected. The game implements all specified features including player movement, shooting, alien swarm behavior, collision detection, scoring, lives system, and wave progression. The visual style matches the described vector aesthetic with neon colors on dark background.
